intro: Galarhoeus shouanensis, commonly known as the Shouan's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine pubescence, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
